name: 使徒行传
description: 记录早期教会的建立和使徒们传福音的历史，见证圣灵的大能

verses.zh: 提阿非罗啊，我已经作了前书，论到耶稣开头一切所行所教导的，
verses.en: In my former book, Theophilus, I wrote about all that Jesus began to do and to teach

verses.zh: 直到他借着圣灵吩咐所拣选的使徒，以后被接上升的日子为止。
verses.en: until the day he was taken up to heaven, after giving instructions through the Holy Spirit to the apostles he had chosen.

verses.zh: 他受害之后，用许多的凭据将自己活活地显给使徒看，四十天之久向他们显现，讲说神国的事。
verses.en: After his suffering, he presented himself to them and gave many convincing proofs that he was alive. He appeared to them over a period of forty days and spoke about the kingdom of God.

verses.zh: 耶稣和他们聚集的时候，嘱咐他们说：不要离开耶路撒冷，要等候父所应许的，就是你们听见我说的。
verses.en: On one occasion, while he was eating with them, he gave them this command: Do not leave Jerusalem, but wait for the gift my Father promised, which you have heard me speak about.

verses.zh: 约翰是用水施洗，但不多几日，你们要受圣灵的洗。
verses.en: For John baptized with water, but in a few days you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.

verses.zh: 他们聚集的时候，问耶稣说：主啊，你复兴以色列国就在这时候吗？
verses.en: Then they gathered around him and asked him, Lord, are you at this time going to restore the kingdom to Israel?

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：父凭着自己的权柄所定的时候、日期，不是你们可以知道的。
verses.en: He said to them: It is not for you to know the times or dates the Father has set by his own authority.

verses.zh: 但圣灵降临在你们身上，你们就必得着能力；并要在耶路撒冷、犹太全地和撒玛利亚，直到地极，作我的见证。
verses.en: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.

verses.zh: 说了这话，他们正看的时候，他就被取上升，有一朵云彩把他接去，便看不见他了。
verses.en: After he said this, he was taken up before their very eyes, and a cloud hid him from their sight.

verses.zh: 当他往上去，他们定睛望天的时候，忽然有两个人，身穿白衣，站在旁边，说：
verses.en: They were looking intently up into the sky as he was going, when suddenly two men dressed in white stood beside them.

verses.zh: 加利利人哪，你们为什么站着望天呢？这离开你们被接升天的耶稣，你们见他怎样往天上去，他还要怎样来。
verses.en: Men of Galilee, they said, why do you stand here looking into the sky? This same Jesus, who has been taken from you into heaven, will come back in the same way you have seen him go into heaven.

verses.zh: 有一座山，名叫橄榄山，离耶路撒冷不远，约有安息日可走的路程。当下门徒从那里回耶路撒冷去，
verses.en: Then the apostles returned to Jerusalem from the hill called the Mount of Olives, a Sabbath day's walk from the city.

verses.zh: 进了城，就上了所住的一间楼房；在那里有彼得、约翰、雅各、安得烈、腓力、多马、巴多罗买、马太、亚勒腓的儿子雅各、奋锐党的西门，和雅各的儿子犹大。
verses.en: When they arrived, they went upstairs to the room where they were staying. Those present were Peter, John, James and Andrew; Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew; James son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot, and Judas son of James.

verses.zh: 这些人都同心合意地恒切祷告；还有几个妇人，和耶稣的母亲马利亚，并耶稣的弟兄们。
verses.en: They all joined together constantly in prayer, along with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.

verses.zh: 那时，有许多人聚会，约有一百二十名，彼得在弟兄中间站起来，说：
verses.en: In those days Peter stood up among the believers (a group numbering about a hundred and twenty)

verses.zh: 诸位弟兄，圣灵借大卫的口，在圣经上预言领人捉拿耶稣的犹大，这话是必须应验的。
verses.en: and said, Brothers and sisters, the Scripture had to be fulfilled in which the Holy Spirit spoke long ago through David concerning Judas, who served as guide for those who arrested Jesus.

verses.zh: 他本来列在我们数中，并且在使徒的职任上得了一分。
verses.en: He was one of our number and shared in our ministry.

verses.zh: 这人用他作恶的工价买了一块田，以后身子仆倒，肚腹崩裂，肠子都流出来。
verses.en: With the payment he received for his wickedness, Judas bought a field; there he fell headlong, his body burst open and all his intestines spilled out.

verses.zh: 住在耶路撒冷的众人都知道这事，所以按着他们那里的话给那块田起名叫亚革大马，就是血田的意思。
verses.en: Everyone in Jerusalem heard about this, so they called that field in their language Akeldama, that is, Field of Blood.

verses.zh: 因为诗篇上写着说：愿他的住处变为荒场，无人住在其中；又说：愿别人得他的职分。
verses.en: For, as it is written in the Book of Psalms: May his place be deserted; let there be no one to dwell in it, and, May another take his place of leadership.

verses.zh: 所以，人在从主耶稣在我们中间始终出入的时候，
verses.en: Therefore it is necessary to choose one of the men who have been with us the whole time the Lord Jesus was living among us,

verses.zh: 就是从约翰施洗起，直到主离开我们被接上升的日子为止，必须从那常与我们作见证的人中，立一位与我们同作耶稣复活的见证。
verses.en: beginning from John's baptism to the time when Jesus was taken up from us. For one of these must become a witness with us of his resurrection.

verses.zh: 于是选举两个人，就是那叫作巴撒巴，又称呼犹士都的约瑟，和马提亚。
verses.en: So they nominated two men: Joseph called Barsabbas (also known as Justus) and Matthias.

verses.zh: 众人就祷告说：主啊，你知道万人的心，求你从这两个人中，指明你所拣选的是谁，叫他得这使徒的位分。
verses.en: Then they prayed, Lord, you know everyone's heart. Show us which of these two you have chosen

verses.zh: 这使徒的职任，本是犹大离开我们而去的。
verses.en: to take over this apostolic ministry, which Judas left to go where he belongs.

verses.zh: 他们就拈阄，阄落在马提亚身上；他就和十一个使徒同列。
verses.en: Then they cast lots, and the lot fell to Matthias; so he was added to the eleven apostles.

verses.zh: 五旬节到了，门徒都聚集在一处。
verses.en: When the day of Pentecost came, they were all together in one place.

verses.zh: 忽然，从天上有响声下来，好像一阵大风吹过，充满了他们所坐的屋子。
verses.en: Suddenly a sound like the blowing of a violent wind came from heaven and filled the whole house where they were sitting.

verses.zh: 又有舌头如火焰显现出来，分开落在他们各人头上。
verses.en: They saw what seemed to be tongues of fire that separated and came to rest on each of them.

verses.zh: 他们就都被圣灵充满，按着圣灵所赐的口才，说起别国的话来。
verses.en: All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues as the Spirit enabled them.

verses.zh: 那时，有虔诚的犹太人，从天下各国来，住在耶路撒冷。
verses.en: Now there were staying in Jerusalem God-fearing Jews from every nation under heaven.

verses.zh: 这声音一响，众人都来聚集，各人听见门徒用众人的乡谈说话，就甚纳闷。
verses.en: When they heard this sound, a crowd came together in bewilderment, because each one heard their own language being spoken.

verses.zh: 都惊讶希奇说：看哪，这说话的不都是加利利人吗？
verses.en: Utterly amazed, they asked: Aren't all these who are speaking Galileans?

verses.zh: 我们各人怎么听见他们说我们生来所用的乡谈呢？
verses.en: Then how is it that each of us hears them in our native language?

verses.zh: 我们帕提亚人、玛代人、以拦人，和住在美索不达米亚、犹太、加帕多家、本都、亚西亚、
verses.en: Parthians, Medes and Elamites; residents of Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,

verses.zh: 弗吕家、旁非利亚、埃及的人，并靠近古利奈的吕彼亚一带地方的人，从罗马来的客旅中，或是犹太人，或是进犹太教的人，
verses.en: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya near Cyrene; visitors from Rome (both Jews and converts to Judaism);

verses.zh: 克里特和阿拉伯人，都听见他们用我们的乡谈，讲说神的大作为。
verses.en: Cretans and Arabs—we hear them declaring the wonders of God in our own tongues!

verses.zh: 众人就都惊讶猜疑，彼此说：这是什么意思呢？
verses.en: Amazed and perplexed, they asked one another, What does this mean?

verses.zh: 还有人讥诮说：他们无非是新酒灌满了。
verses.en: Some, however, made fun of them and said, They have had too much wine.

verses.zh: 彼得和十一个使徒站起，高声说：犹太人和一切住在耶路撒冷的人哪，这件事你们当知道，也当侧耳听我的话。
verses.en: Then Peter stood up with the Eleven, raised his voice and addressed the crowd: Fellow Jews and all of you who live in Jerusalem, let me explain this to you; listen carefully to what I say.

verses.zh: 你们想这些人是醉了，其实不是醉了，因为时候刚到巳初。
verses.en: These people are not drunk, as you suppose. It's only nine in the morning!

verses.zh: 这正是先知约珥所说的：
verses.en: No, this is what was spoken by the prophet Joel:

verses.zh: 神说：在末后的日子，我要将我的灵浇灌凡有血气的。你们的儿女要说预言；你们的少年人要见异象；老年人要做异梦。
verses.en: In the last days, God says, I will pour out my Spirit on all people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your young men will see visions, your old men will dream dreams.

verses.zh: 在那些日子，我要将我的灵浇灌我的仆人和使女，他们就要说预言。
verses.en: Even on my servants, both men and women, I will pour out my Spirit in those days, and they will prophesy.

verses.zh: 我在天上要显出奇事，在地下要显出神迹，有血、有火、有烟雾。
verses.en: I will show wonders in the heavens above and signs on the earth below, blood and fire and billows of smoke.

verses.zh: 日头要变为黑暗，月亮要变为血，这都在主大而明显的日子未到以前。
verses.en: The sun will be turned to darkness and the moon to blood before the coming of the great and glorious day of the Lord.

verses.zh: 到那时候，凡求告主名的，就必得救。
verses.en: And everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.

verses.zh: 以色列人哪，请听我的话：神借着拿撒勒人耶稣，在你们中间施行异能、奇事、神迹，将他证明出来，这是你们自己知道的。
verses.en: Fellow Israelites, listen to this: Jesus of Nazareth was a man accredited by God to you by miracles, wonders and signs, which God did among you through him, as you yourselves know.

verses.zh: 他既按着神的定旨先见被交与人，你们就借着无法之人的手，把他钉在十字架上，杀了。
verses.en: This man was handed over to you by God's deliberate plan and foreknowledge; and you, with the help of wicked men, put him to death by nailing him to the cross.

verses.zh: 神却将死的痛苦解释了，叫他复活，因为他原不能被死拘禁。
verses.en: But God raised him from the dead, freeing him from the agony of death, because it was impossible for death to keep its hold on him.

verses.zh: 大卫指着他说：我看见主常在我眼前，他在我右边，叫我不至于摇动。
verses.en: David said about him: I saw the Lord always before me. Because he is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.

verses.zh: 所以，我心欢喜，我的灵快乐；我的肉身也要安居在指望中。
verses.en: Therefore my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices; my body also will rest in hope,

verses.zh: 因为你必不将我的灵魂撇在阴间，也不叫你的圣者见朽坏。
verses.en: because you will not abandon me to the realm of the dead, you will not let your holy one see decay.

verses.zh: 你已将生命的道路指示我，必叫我因见你的面，得着满足的快乐。
verses.en: You have made known to me the paths of life; you will fill me with joy in your presence.

verses.zh: 诸位弟兄，先祖大卫的事，我可以明明地对你们说，他死了，也葬埋了，并且他的坟墓直到今日还在我们这里。
verses.en: Fellow Israelites, I can tell you confidently that the patriarch David died and was buried, and his tomb is here to this day.

verses.zh: 大卫既是先知，又晓得神曾向他起誓，要从他的后裔中立一位坐在他的宝座上，
verses.en: But he was a prophet and knew that God had promised him on oath that he would place one of his descendants on his throne.

verses.zh: 就预先看明这事，讲论基督复活说：他的灵魂不撇在阴间，他的肉身也不见朽坏。
verses.en: Seeing what was to come, he spoke of the resurrection of the Messiah, that he was not abandoned to the realm of the dead, nor did his body see decay.

verses.zh: 这耶稣，神已经叫他复活了，我们都为这事作见证。
verses.en: God has raised this Jesus to life, and we are all witnesses of it.

verses.zh: 他既被神的右手高举，又从父受了所应许的圣灵，就把你们所看见所听见的浇灌下来。
verses.en: Exalted to the right hand of God, he has received from the Father the promised Holy Spirit and has poured out what you now see and hear.

verses.zh: 大卫并没有升到天上，但自己说：主对我主说：你坐在我右边，
verses.en: For David did not ascend to heaven, and yet he said, The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand

verses.zh: 等我使你的仇敌作你的脚凳。
verses.en: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.

verses.zh: 故此，以色列全家当确实地知道，你们钉在十字架上的这位耶稣，神已经立他为主，为基督了。
verses.en: Therefore let all Israel be assured of this: God has made this Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Messiah.

verses.zh: 众人听见这话，觉得扎心，就对彼得和其余的使徒说：诸位弟兄，我们当怎样行？
verses.en: When the people heard this, they were cut to the heart and said to Peter and the other apostles, Brothers, what shall we do?

verses.zh: 彼得说：你们各人要悔改，奉耶稣基督的名受洗，叫你们的罪得赦，就必领受所赐的圣灵。
verses.en: Peter replied, Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

verses.zh: 因为这应许是给你们和你们的儿女，并一切在远方的人，就是主我们神所召来的。
verses.en: The promise is for you and your children and for all who are far off—for all whom the Lord our God will call.

verses.zh: 彼得还用许多别的话作见证，劝勉他们说：你们当救自己脱离这弯曲的世代。
verses.en: With many other words he warned them; and he pleaded with them, Save yourselves from this corrupt generation.

verses.zh: 于是领受他话的人就受了洗。那一天，门徒约添了三千人。
verses.en: Those who accepted his message were baptized, and about three thousand were added to their number that day.

verses.zh: 都恒心遵守使徒的教训，彼此交接、掰饼、祈祷。
verses.en: They devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and to fellowship, to the breaking of bread and to prayer.

verses.zh: 众人都惧怕；使徒又行了许多奇事神迹。
verses.en: Everyone was filled with awe at the many wonders and signs performed by the apostles.

verses.zh: 信的人都在一处，凡物公用，
verses.en: All the believers were together and had everything in common.

verses.zh: 并且卖了田产家业，照各人所需用的分给各人。
verses.en: They sold property and possessions to give to anyone who had need.

verses.zh: 他们天天同心合意恒切地在殿里，且在家中掰饼，存着欢喜诚实的心用饭，
verses.en: They worshiped together at the Temple each day, met in homes for the Lord's Supper, and shared their meals with great joy and generosity—

verses.zh: 赞美神，得众民的喜爱。主将得救的人天天加给他们。
verses.en: all the while praising God and enjoying the goodwill of all the people. And each day the Lord added to their fellowship those who were being saved.

verses.zh: 申初祷告的时候，彼得、约翰上圣殿去。
verses.en: One day Peter and John were going up to the temple at the time of prayer—at three in the afternoon.

verses.zh: 有一个人生来是瘸腿的，天天被人抬来，放在殿的一个门口，那门名叫美门，要求进殿的人周济。
verses.en: Now a man who was lame from birth was being carried to the temple gate called Beautiful, where he was put every day to beg from those going into the temple courts.

verses.zh: 他看见彼得、约翰将要进殿，就求他们周济。
verses.en: When he saw Peter and John about to enter, he asked them for money.

verses.zh: 彼得、约翰定睛看他。彼得说：你看我们。
verses.en: Peter looked straight at him, as did John. Then Peter said, Look at us!

verses.zh: 那人就留意看他们，指望得着什么。
verses.en: So the man paid attention to them, expecting to get something from them.

verses.zh: 彼得说：金银我都没有，只把我所有的给你。我奉拿撒勒人耶稣基督的名，叫你起来行走。
verses.en: Then Peter said, Silver or gold I do not have, but what I do have I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, walk.

verses.zh: 于是拉着他的右手，扶他起来；他的脚和踝子骨立刻健壮了，
verses.en: Taking him by the right hand, he helped him up, and instantly the man's feet and ankles became strong.

verses.zh: 他跳起来，站着，又行走，同他们进了殿，走着，跳着，赞美神。
verses.en: He jumped to his feet and began to walk. Then he went with them into the temple courts, walking and jumping, and praising God.

verses.zh: 百姓都看见他行走，赞美神。
verses.en: When all the people saw him walking and praising God,

verses.zh: 认得他是那素常坐在殿的美门口求周济的，就因他所遇着的事，满心希奇惊讶。
verses.en: they recognized him as the same man who used to sit begging at the temple gate called Beautiful, and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.

verses.zh: 那人正在称为所罗门的廊下，拉着彼得、约翰；众百姓一齐跑到他们那里，很觉希奇。
verses.en: While the man held on to Peter and John, all the people were astonished and came running to them in the place called Solomon's Colonnade.

verses.zh: 彼得看见，就对百姓说：以色列人哪，为什么把这事当作希奇呢？为什么定睛看我们，以为我们凭自己的能力和虔诚使这人行走呢？
verses.en: When Peter saw this, he said to them: Fellow Israelites, why does this surprise you? Why do you stare at us as if by our own power or godliness we had made this man walk?

verses.zh: 亚伯拉罕、以撒、雅各的神，就是我们列祖的神，已经荣耀了他的仆人耶稣；你们却把他交付彼拉多。彼拉多定意要释放他，你们竟在彼拉多面前弃绝了他。
verses.en: The God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his servant Jesus. You handed him over to be killed, and you disowned him before Pilate, though he had decided to let him go.

verses.zh: 你们弃绝了那圣洁公义者，反求着释放一个凶手给你们。
verses.en: You disowned the Holy and Righteous One and asked that a murderer be released to you.

verses.zh: 你们杀了那生命的主，神却叫他从死里复活了；我们都是为这事作见证。
verses.en: You killed the author of life, but God raised him from the dead. We are witnesses of this.

verses.zh: 我们因信他的名，他的名便叫你们所看见所认识的这人健壮了；正是他所赐的信心，叫这人在你们众人面前全然好了。
verses.en: By faith in the name of Jesus, this man whom you see and know was made strong. It is Jesus' name and the faith that comes through him that has completely healed him, as you can all see.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我知道你们做这事是出于不知，你们的官长也是如此。
verses.en: Now, fellow Israelites, I know that you acted in ignorance, as did your leaders.

verses.zh: 但神曾借众先知的口，预言基督将要受害，就这样应验了。
verses.en: But this is how God fulfilled what he had foretold through all the prophets, saying that his Messiah would suffer.

verses.zh: 所以你们当悔改归正，使你们的罪得以涂抹，这样，那安舒的日子就必从主面前来到。
verses.en: Repent, then, and turn to God, so that your sins may be wiped out, that times of refreshing may come from the Lord.

verses.zh: 主也必差遣所预定给你们的基督耶稣降临。
verses.en: And he will send the Messiah, who has been appointed for you—even Jesus.

verses.zh: 天必留他，直到万物复兴的时候，就是神从创世以来，借着圣先知的口所说的。
verses.en: Heaven must receive him until the time comes for God to restore everything, as he promised long ago through his holy prophets.

verses.zh: 摩西曾说：主神要从你们弟兄中间，给你们兴起一位先知像我，凡他向你们所说的，你们都要听从。
verses.en: For Moses said, The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your own people; you must listen to everything he tells you.

verses.zh: 凡不听从那先知的，必要从民中全然灭绝。
verses.en: Anyone who does not listen to him will be completely cut off from their people.

verses.zh: 从撒母耳以来的众先知，每一个也都讲论这些日子。
verses.en: Indeed, beginning with Samuel, all the prophets who have spoken have foretold these days.

verses.zh: 你们是先知的子孙，也承受神与你们祖宗所立的约，就是对亚伯拉罕说：地上万族都要因你的后裔得福。
verses.en: And you are heirs of the prophets and of the covenant God made with your fathers. He said to Abraham, Through your offspring all peoples on earth will be blessed.

verses.zh: 神既兴起他的仆人，就先差他到你们这里来，赐福给你们，叫你们各人回转，离开罪恶。
verses.en: When God raised up his servant, he sent him first to you to bless you by turning each of you from your wicked ways.

verses.zh: 使徒对百姓说话的时候，祭司们和守殿官，并撒都该人，忽然来了。
verses.en: The priests and the captain of the temple guard and the Sadducees came up to Peter and John while they were speaking to the people.

verses.zh: 因他们教训百姓，本着耶稣，传说死人复活，就很烦恼，
verses.en: They were greatly disturbed because the apostles were teaching the people, proclaiming in Jesus the resurrection of the dead.

verses.zh: 于是下手拿住他们。因为天已经晚了，就把他们押到第二天。
verses.en: They seized Peter and John and, because it was evening, they put them in jail until the next day.

verses.zh: 但听道之人有许多信的，男丁数目约到五千。
verses.en: But many who heard the message believed; so the number of men who believed grew to about five thousand.

verses.zh: 第二天，官府、长老，和文士，在耶路撒冷聚会。
verses.en: The next day the rulers, the elders and the teachers of the law met in Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 又有大祭司亚那和该亚法、约翰、亚历山大，并大祭司的亲族都在那里。
verses.en: Annas the high priest was there, and so were Caiaphas, John, Alexander and others of the high priest's family.

verses.zh: 他们叫使徒站在当中，问他们说：你们用什么能力，奉谁的名做这事呢？
verses.en: They had Peter and John brought before them and began to question them: By what power or what name did you do this?

verses.zh: 那时彼得被圣灵充满，对他们说：
verses.en: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them: Rulers and elders of the people!

verses.zh: 官府和长老啊，若是今日因为在残疾人身上所行的善事，查问我们他是怎样得了痊愈，
verses.en: If we are being called to account today for an act of kindness shown to a man who was lame and are being asked how he was healed,

verses.zh: 你们众人和以色列百姓都当知道，站在你们面前的这人得痊愈，是因你们所钉十字架，神叫他从死里复活的拿撒勒人耶稣基督的名。
verses.en: then know this, you and all the people of Israel: It is by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified but whom God raised from the dead, that this man stands before you healed.

verses.zh: 他是你们匠人所弃的石头，已成了房角的头块石头。
verses.en: Jesus is the stone you builders rejected, which has become the cornerstone.

verses.zh: 除他以外，别无拯救，因为在天下人间，没有赐下别的名我们可以靠着得救。
verses.en: Salvation is found in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given to mankind by which we must be saved.

verses.zh: 他们见彼得、约翰的胆量，又看出他们原是没有学问的小民，就希奇，认明他们是跟过耶稣的。
verses.en: When they saw the courage of Peter and John and realized that they were unschooled, ordinary men, they were astonished and they took note that these men had been with Jesus.

verses.zh: 又看见那治好了的人和他们一同站着，就无话可驳。
verses.en: But since they could see the man who had been healed standing there with them, there was nothing they could say.

verses.zh: 于是吩咐他们从公会出去，就彼此商议说：
verses.en: So they ordered them to withdraw from the Sanhedrin and then conferred together.

verses.zh: 我们当怎样办这两个人呢？因为他们诚然行了一件明显的神迹，凡住耶路撒冷的人都知道，我们也不能说没有。
verses.en: What are we going to do with these men? they asked. Everyone living in Jerusalem knows they have performed a notable sign, and we cannot deny it.

verses.zh: 惟恐这事越发传扬在民间，我们必须恐吓他们，叫他们不再奉这名对人讲论。
verses.en: But to stop this thing from spreading any further among the people, we must warn them to speak no longer to anyone in this name.

verses.zh: 于是叫了他们来，禁止他们总不可奉耶稣的名讲论教训。
verses.en: Then they called them in again and commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.

verses.zh: 彼得、约翰说：听从你们，不听从神，这在神面前合理不合理，你们自己酌量吧。
verses.en: But Peter and John replied, Which is right in God's eyes: to listen to you, or to him? You be the judges!

verses.zh: 我们所看见所听见的，不能不说。
verses.en: As for us, we cannot help speaking about what we have seen and heard.

verses.zh: 官长为百姓的缘故，想不出法子刑罚他们，又恐吓一番，把他们释放了。
verses.en: After further threats they let them go. They could not decide how to punish them, because all the people were praising God for what had happened.

verses.zh: 因为那人得医治的神迹显明在众人眼前，他们的年纪已有四十多岁。
verses.en: For the man who was miraculously healed was over forty years old.

verses.zh: 二人既被释放，就到会友那里去，把祭司长和长老所说的话都告诉他们。
verses.en: On their release, Peter and John went back to their own people and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.

verses.zh: 他们听见了，就同心合意地高声向神说：主啊，你是造天、地、海，和其中万物的。
verses.en: When they heard this, they raised their voices together in prayer to God. Sovereign Lord, they said, you made the heavens and the earth and the sea, and everything in them.

verses.zh: 你借着圣灵托你仆人我们祖宗大卫的口，说：外邦为什么争闹？万民为什么谋算虚妄的事？
verses.en: You spoke by the Holy Spirit through the mouth of your servant, our father David: Why do the nations rage and the peoples plot in vain?

verses.zh: 世上的君王一齐起来，臣宰也聚集，要敌挡主，并主的受膏者。
verses.en: The kings of the earth rise up and the rulers band together against the Lord and against his anointed one.

verses.zh: 希律和本丢彼拉多，外邦人和以色列民，果然在这城里聚集，要攻打你所膏的圣仆耶稣，
verses.en: Indeed Herod and Pontius Pilate met together with the Gentiles and the people of Israel in this city to conspire against your holy servant Jesus, whom you anointed.

verses.zh: 成就你手和你意旨所预定必有的事。
verses.en: They did what your power and will had decided beforehand should happen.

verses.zh: 他们恐吓我们，现在求主鉴察，一面叫你仆人大放胆量讲你的道，
verses.en: Now, Lord, consider their threats and enable your servants to speak your word with great boldness.

verses.zh: 一面伸出你的手来医治疾病，并且使神迹奇事因着你圣仆耶稣的名行出来。
verses.en: Stretch out your hand to heal and perform signs and wonders through the name of your holy servant Jesus.

verses.zh: 祷告完了，聚会的地方震动，他们就都被圣灵充满，放胆讲论神的道。
verses.en: After they prayed, the place where they were meeting was shaken. And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and spoke the word of God boldly.

verses.zh: 那许多信的人都是一心一意的，没有一人说他的东西是自己的，都是大家公用。
verses.en: All the believers were one in heart and mind. No one claimed that any of their possessions was their own, but they shared everything they had.

verses.zh: 使徒大有能力，见证主耶稣复活；众人也都蒙大恩。
verses.en: With great power the apostles continued to testify to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. And God's grace was so powerfully at work in them all

verses.zh: 内中也没有一个缺乏的，因为人人将田产房屋都卖了，把所卖的价银拿来，放在使徒脚前。
verses.en: that there were no needy persons among them. For from time to time those who owned land or houses sold them, brought the money from the sales

verses.zh: 照各人所需用的，分给各人。
verses.en: and put it at the apostles' feet, and it was distributed to anyone who had need.

verses.zh: 有一个利未人，生在塞浦路斯，名叫约瑟，使徒称他为巴拿巴，巴拿巴翻出来，就是劝慰子。
verses.en: Joseph, a Levite from Cyprus, whom the apostles called Barnabas (which means son of encouragement),

verses.zh: 他有田地，也卖了，把价银拿来，放在使徒脚前。
verses.en: sold a field he owned and brought the money and put it at the apostles' feet.

verses.zh: 有一个人名叫亚拿尼亚，同他的妻子撒非喇，卖了田产。
verses.en: Now a man named Ananias, together with his wife Sapphira, also sold a piece of property.

verses.zh: 私下留下一部分，妻子也知道，其余的一部分拿来，放在使徒脚前。
verses.en: With his wife's full knowledge he kept back part of the money for himself, but brought the rest and put it at the apostles' feet.

verses.zh: 彼得说：亚拿尼亚，为什么撒但充满了你的心，叫你欺哄圣灵，把田地的价银私自留下几分呢？
verses.en: Then Peter said, Ananias, how is it that Satan has so filled your heart that you have lied to the Holy Spirit and have kept for yourself some of the money you received for the land?

verses.zh: 田地还没有卖，不是你自己的吗？既卖了，价银不是你作主吗？你怎么心里起这意念呢？你不是欺哄人，是欺哄神了。
verses.en: Didn't it belong to you before it was sold? And after it was sold, wasn't the money at your disposal? What made you think of doing such a thing? You have not lied just to human beings but to God.

verses.zh: 亚拿尼亚听见这话，就仆倒，断了气。听见的人都甚惧怕。
verses.en: When Ananias heard this, he fell down and died. And great fear seized all who heard what had happened.

verses.zh: 有些少年人起来，把他包裹，抬出去埋葬了。
verses.en: Then some young men came forward, wrapped up his body, and carried him out and buried him.

verses.zh: 约过了三小时，他的妻子进来，还不知道这事。
verses.en: About three hours later his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.

verses.zh: 彼得对她说：你告诉我，你们卖田地的价银就是这些吗？她说：就是这些。
verses.en: Peter asked her, Tell me, is this the price you and Ananias got for the land? Yes, she said, that is the price.

verses.zh: 彼得说：你们为什么同心试探主的灵呢？埋葬你丈夫之人的脚已到门口，他们也要把你抬出去。
verses.en: Peter said to her, How could you conspire to test the Spirit of the Lord? Listen! The feet of the men who buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out also.

verses.zh: 妇人立刻仆倒在他脚前，断了气。那些少年人进来，见她已经死了，就抬出去，埋在她丈夫旁边。
verses.en: At that moment she fell down at his feet and died. Then the young men came in and, finding her dead, carried her out and buried her beside her husband.

verses.zh: 全教会和听见这事的人都甚惧怕。
verses.en: Great fear seized the whole church and all who heard about these events.

verses.zh: 主借使徒的手在民间行了许多神迹奇事，他们（或作：他们同心合意）都在所罗门的廊下。
verses.en: The apostles performed many signs and wonders among the people. And all the believers used to meet together in Solomon's Colonnade.

verses.zh: 其余的人没有一个敢贴近他们，百姓却尊重他们。
verses.en: No one else dared join them, even though they were highly regarded by the people.

verses.zh: 信而归主的人越发增添，连男带女很多。
verses.en: Nevertheless, more and more men and women believed in the Lord and were added to their number.

verses.zh: 甚至有人将病人抬到街上，放在床上或褥子上，指望彼得过的时候，或者他的影儿能照在谁的身上。
verses.en: As a result, people brought the sick into the streets and laid them on beds and mats so that at least Peter's shadow might fall on some of them as he passed by.

verses.zh: 还有许多人带着病人和被污鬼缠磨的，从耶路撒冷四围的城邑来，全都得了医治。
verses.en: Crowds gathered also from the towns around Jerusalem, bringing their sick and those tormented by impure spirits, and all of them were healed.

verses.zh: 大祭司和他的一切同人，就是撒都该党，都起来，满心忌恨，
verses.en: Then the high priest and all his associates, who were members of the party of the Sadducees, were filled with jealousy.

verses.zh: 就下手拿住使徒，收在外监。
verses.en: They arrested the apostles and put them in the public jail.

verses.zh: 但主的使者夜间开了监门，领他们出来，说：
verses.en: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the doors of the jail and brought them out.

verses.zh: 你们去站在殿里，把这生命的道都讲给百姓听。
verses.en: Go, stand in the temple courts, he said, and tell the people all about this new life.

verses.zh: 使徒听了这话，天将亮的时候，就进了殿，教训百姓。大祭司和他的同人来了，叫齐公会的人和以色列族的众长老，就差人到监里去，要把使徒提出来。
verses.en: At daybreak they entered the temple courts, as they had been told, and began to teach the people. When the high priest and his associates arrived, they called together the Sanhedrin—the full assembly of the elders of Israel—and sent to the jail for the apostles.

verses.zh: 但差役到了，不见他们在监里，就回来禀报说：
verses.en: But on arriving at the jail, the officers did not find them there. So they went back and reported,

verses.zh: 我们看见监牢关得严紧，守卫也都站在门外，但开了门，一人也不见在里面。
verses.en: We found the jail securely locked, with the guards standing at the doors; but when we opened them, we found no one inside.

verses.zh: 守殿官和祭司长听见这话，心里犯难，不知这事将来如何。
verses.en: On hearing this report, the captain of the temple guard and the chief priests were at a loss, wondering what this might lead to.

verses.zh: 有一个人来禀报说：你们收在监里的人，现在站在殿里教训百姓。
verses.en: Then someone came and said, Look! The men you put in jail are standing in the temple courts teaching the people.

verses.zh: 于是守殿官和差役去带他们来，并没有用强暴，因为怕百姓用石头打他们。
verses.en: At that, the captain went with his officers and brought the apostles. They did not use force, because they feared that the people would stone them.

verses.zh: 带到了，便叫他们站在公会前。大祭司问他们说：
verses.en: The apostles were brought in and made to appear before the Sanhedrin to be questioned by the high priest.

verses.zh: 我们不是严严地禁止你们，不可奉这名教训人吗？你们倒把你们的道理充满了耶路撒冷，想要叫这人的血归到我们身上。
verses.en: We gave you strict orders not to teach in this name, he said. Yet you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching and are determined to make us guilty of this man's blood.

verses.zh: 彼得和众使徒回答说：顺从神，不顺从人，是应当的。
verses.en: Peter and the other apostles replied: We must obey God rather than human beings!

verses.zh: 你们挂在木头上杀害的耶稣，我们祖宗的神已经叫他复活。
verses.en: You killed the author of life, but God raised him from the dead. We are witnesses of this.

verses.zh: 神且用右手将他高举，叫他作君王，作救主，将悔改的心和赦罪的恩赐给以色列人。
verses.en: God exalted him to his own right hand as Prince and Savior that he might bring Israel to repentance and forgive their sins.

verses.zh: 我们为这事作见证，神赐给顺从之人圣灵，也为这见证。
verses.en: We are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.

verses.zh: 公会的人听见这话，就极其恼怒，想要杀他们。
verses.en: When they heard this, they were furious and wanted to put them to death.

verses.zh: 但有一个法利赛人，名叫迦玛列，是众百姓所敬重的教法师，在公会中站起来，吩咐人把使徒暂且带到外面去。
verses.en: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, who was honored by all the people, stood up in the Sanhedrin and ordered that the men be put outside for a little while.

verses.zh: 他对众人说：以色列人哪，论到这些人，你们应当小心怎样办理。
verses.en: Then he addressed the Sanhedrin: Men of Israel, consider carefully what you intend to do to these men.

verses.zh: 从前丢大起来，自夸为大，附和他的人约有四百，他被杀了，附和他的人也都散了，归于无有。
verses.en: Some time ago Theudas appeared, claiming to be somebody, and about four hundred men rallied to him. He was killed, all his followers were dispersed, and it all came to nothing.

verses.zh: 此后报名上册的时候，又有加利利人犹大起来，引诱些百姓跟从他，他也灭亡，附和他的人也都四散了。
verses.en: After him, Judas the Galilean appeared in the days of the census and led a band of people in revolt. He too was killed, and all his followers were scattered.

verses.zh: 现在我劝你们，不要管这些人，任凭他们吧。他们所谋的，所行的，若是出于人，必要败坏；
verses.en: Therefore, in the present case I advise you: Leave these men alone! Let them go! For if their purpose or activity is of human origin, it will fail.

verses.zh: 若是出于神，你们就不能败坏他们，恐怕你们倒是攻击神了。
verses.en: But if it is from God, you will not be able to stop these men; you will only find yourselves fighting against God.

verses.zh: 公会的人听从了他，便叫使徒来，把他们打了，又吩咐他们不可奉耶稣的名讲论，就把他们释放了。
verses.en: His speech persuaded them. They called the apostles in and had them flogged. Then they ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.

verses.zh: 他们离开公会，心里欢喜，因被算是配为这名受辱。
verses.en: The apostles left the Sanhedrin, rejoicing because they had been counted worthy of suffering disgrace for the Name.

verses.zh: 他们就每日在殿里，在家里，不住地教训人，传耶稣是基督。
verses.en: Day after day, in the temple courts and from house to house, they never stopped teaching and proclaiming the good news that Jesus is the Messiah.

verses.zh: 那时，门徒增多，有说希腊话的犹太人向希伯来人发怨言，因为在每天的分粮上忽略了他们的寡妇。
verses.en: In those days when the number of disciples was increasing, the Hellenistic Jews among them complained against the Hebraic Jews because their widows were being overlooked in the daily distribution of food.

verses.zh: 十二使徒叫众门徒来，对他们说：我们撇下神的道去管理饭食，原是不合宜的。
verses.en: So the Twelve gathered all the disciples together and said, It would not be right for us to neglect the ministry of the word of God in order to wait on tables.

verses.zh: 所以弟兄们，当从你们中间选出七个有好名声、被圣灵充满、智慧充足的人，我们就派他们管理这事。
verses.en: Brothers and sisters, choose seven men from among you who are known to be full of the Spirit and wisdom. We will turn this responsibility over to them

verses.zh: 但我们要专心以祈祷传道为事。
verses.en: and will give our attention to prayer and the ministry of the word.

verses.zh: 这话在众人面前都合宜。众人就拣选了司提反，乃是大有信心、圣灵充满的人，又拣选腓利、伯罗哥罗、尼迦挪、提门、巴米拿，并进犹太教的安提阿人尼哥拉。
verses.en: This proposal pleased the whole group. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit; also Philip, Procorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas from Antioch, a convert to Judaism.

verses.zh: 叫他们站在使徒面前。使徒祷告了，就按手在他们头上。
verses.en: They presented these men to the apostles, who prayed and laid their hands on them.

verses.zh: 神的道兴旺起来。在耶路撒冷门徒数目大大增多，也有许多祭司信从了这道。
verses.en: So the word of God spread. The number of disciples in Jerusalem increased rapidly, and a large number of priests became obedient to the faith.

verses.zh: 司提反满得恩惠能力，在民间行了大奇事和神迹。
verses.en: Now Stephen, a man full of God's grace and power, performed great wonders and signs among the people.

verses.zh: 当时有从所谓自由堂──利百地拿、居里扭、亚历山大，并从基利家、亚西亚各处来的犹太人起来，和司提反辩论。
verses.en: Opposition arose, however, from members of the Synagogue of the Freedmen (as it was called)—Jews of Cyrene and Alexandria as well as the provinces of Cilicia and Asia—who began to argue with Stephen.

verses.zh: 司提反是以智慧和圣灵说话，众人敌挡不住。
verses.en: But they could not stand up against the wisdom the Spirit gave him as he spoke.

verses.zh: 于是买出人来，引诱人说：我们听见他说谤讟摩西和神的话。
verses.en: Then they secretly persuaded some men to say, We have heard Stephen speak blasphemous words against Moses and against God.

verses.zh: 他们又耸动了百姓、长老，并文士，就忽然来捉拿他，把他带到公会去。
verses.en: So they stirred up the people and the elders and the teachers of the law. They seized Stephen and brought him before the Sanhedrin.

verses.zh: 有假见证人来，说：这个人说话，不住地糟践这圣所和律法。
verses.en: They produced false witnesses, who testified, This fellow never stops speaking against this holy place and against the law.

verses.zh: 我们听见他说，这拿撒勒人耶稣要毁坏此地，也要改变摩西所交给我们的规条。
verses.en: For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place and change the customs Moses handed down to us.

verses.zh: 在公会里坐着的人都定睛看他，见他的面貌好像天使的面貌。
verses.en: All who were sitting in the Sanhedrin looked intently at Stephen, and they saw that his face was like the face of an angel.

verses.zh: 大祭司就说：这些事果然有吗？
verses.en: Then the high priest asked Stephen, Are these charges true?

verses.zh: 司提反说：诸位父兄请听！当日我们的祖宗亚伯拉罕在美索不达米亚还没有住哈兰的时候，荣耀的神向他显现，
verses.en: To this he replied: Brothers and fathers, listen to me! The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham while he was still in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Harran.

verses.zh: 对他说：你要离开本地和亲族，往我所要指示你的地方去。
verses.en: Leave your country and your people, God said, and go to the land I will show you.

verses.zh: 他就离开迦勒底人之地，住在哈兰。他父亲死了以后，神又使他从那里搬到你们现在所住之地。
verses.en: So he left the land of the Chaldeans and settled in Harran. After the death of his father, God sent him to this land where you are now living.

verses.zh: 在这地方，神并没有给他产业，连立足之地也没有给他。但应许要将这地赐给他和他的后裔为业，那时他还没有儿子。
verses.en: He gave him no inheritance here, not even enough ground to set his foot on. But God promised him that he and his descendants after him would possess the land, even though at that time Abraham had no child.

verses.zh: 神这样说：他的后裔必寄居外邦，那里的人要叫他们作奴仆，苦待他们四百年。
verses.en: God spoke to him in this way: For four hundred years your descendants will be strangers in a country not their own, and they will be enslaved and mistreated.

verses.zh: 神又说：使他们作奴仆的那国，我要惩罚。后来他们要出来，在这地方事奉我。
verses.en: But I will punish the nation they serve as slaves, God said, and afterward they will come out of that country and worship me in this place.

verses.zh: 神又赐他割礼的约。于是亚伯拉罕生了以撒，第八日给他行了割礼。以撒生雅各，雅各生了十二位先祖。
verses.en: Then he gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision. And Abraham became the father of Isaac and circumcised him eight days after his birth. Later Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs.

verses.zh: 先祖们嫉妒约瑟，把他卖到埃及去。但神与他同在，
verses.en: Because the patriarchs were jealous of Joseph, they sold him as a slave into Egypt. But God was with him

verses.zh: 救他脱离一切苦难，又使他在法老面前得恩典有智慧。法老就派他作埃及国的宰相，兼管王宫和全地。
verses.en: and rescued him from all his troubles. He gave Joseph wisdom and enabled him to gain the goodwill of Pharaoh king of Egypt. So Pharaoh made him ruler over Egypt and all his palace.

verses.zh: 后来埃及和迦南全地遭遇饥荒，大受艰难，我们的祖宗就绝了粮。
verses.en: Then a famine struck all Egypt and Canaan, bringing great suffering, and our ancestors could not find food.

verses.zh: 雅各听见在埃及有粮，就打发我们的祖宗初次往那里去。
verses.en: When Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our forefathers on their first visit.

verses.zh: 第二次约瑟与弟兄相认，他的亲族也被法老知道了。
verses.en: On their second visit, Joseph told his brothers who he was, and Pharaoh learned about Joseph's family.

verses.zh: 约瑟就打发弟兄请父亲雅各和全家七十五人来。
verses.en: After this, Joseph sent for his father Jacob and his whole family, seventy-five in all.

verses.zh: 于是雅各下了埃及，后来他和我们的祖宗都死在那里。
verses.en: Then Jacob went down to Egypt, where he and our ancestors died.

verses.zh: 又被带到示剑，葬在亚伯拉罕在示剑用银子从哈抹子孙买来的坟墓里。
verses.en: Their bodies were brought back to Shechem and placed in the tomb that Abraham had bought from the sons of Hamor at Shechem for a certain sum of money.

verses.zh: 及至神应许亚伯拉罕的时候，他的子孙在埃及兴盛众多，
verses.en: As the time drew near for God to fulfill his promise to Abraham, the number of our people in Egypt had greatly increased.

verses.zh: 直到有不晓得约瑟的新王兴起。
verses.en: Then another king, who knew nothing about Joseph, became ruler of Egypt.

verses.zh: 他用诡计待我们的宗族，苦害我们的祖宗，叫他们丢弃婴孩，使婴孩不能存活。
verses.en: He dealt treacherously with our people and oppressed our ancestors by forcing them to throw out their newborn babies so that they would die.

verses.zh: 那时，摩西生下来，俊美非凡，在他父亲家里抚养了三个月。
verses.en: At that time Moses was born, and he was no ordinary child. For three months he was cared for by his family.

verses.zh: 他被丢弃的时候，法老的女儿拾了去，养为自己的儿子。
verses.en: When he was placed outside, Pharaoh's daughter took him and brought him up as her own son.

verses.zh: 摩西学了埃及人一切的学问，说话行事都有才能。
verses.en: Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and was powerful in speech and action.

verses.zh: 他将到四十岁的时候，心中起意，去看望他的弟兄以色列人。
verses.en: When Moses was forty years old, he decided to visit his own people, the Israelites.

verses.zh: 到了那里，见他们一个人受冤屈，就护庇他，为那受欺压的人报仇，打死了那埃及人。
verses.en: He saw one of them being mistreated by an Egyptian, so he went to his defense and avenged him by killing the Egyptian.

verses.zh: 他以为弟兄必明白神是借他的手搭救他们，他们却不明白。
verses.en: Moses thought that his own people would realize that God was using him to rescue them, but they did not.

verses.zh: 第二天，他遇见两个以色列人争斗，就劝他们和睦，说：你们二位是弟兄，为什么彼此欺负呢？
verses.en: The next day Moses came upon two Israelites who were fighting. He tried to reconcile them by saying, Men, you are brothers; why do you want to hurt each other?

verses.zh: 那欺负邻舍的把他推开，说：谁立你作我们的首领和审判官呢？
verses.en: But the man who was mistreating the other pushed Moses aside and said, Who made you ruler and judge over us?

verses.zh: 难道你要杀我，像昨天杀那埃及人一样吗？
verses.en: Do you want to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?

verses.zh: 摩西听见这话就逃走了，寄居在米甸地，在那里生了两个儿子。
verses.en: When Moses heard this, he fled to Midian, where he settled as a foreigner and had two sons.

verses.zh: 过了四十年，在西奈山的旷野，有一位天使在荆棘火焰中向摩西显现。
verses.en: After forty years had passed, an angel appeared to Moses in the flames of a burning bush in the desert near Mount Sinai.

verses.zh: 摩西见了那异象，便觉希奇。正上前观看的时候，有主的声音说：
verses.en: When he saw this, he was amazed at the sight. As he went over to get a closer look, he heard the Lord say:

verses.zh: 我是你列祖的神，就是亚伯拉罕、以撒、雅各的神。摩西战战兢兢，不敢观看。
verses.en: I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. Moses trembled with fear and did not dare to look.

verses.zh: 主对他说：把你脚上的鞋脱下来，因为你所站之地是圣地。
verses.en: Then the Lord said to him, Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.

verses.zh: 我的百姓在埃及所受的困苦，我实在看见了，他们悲叹的声音，我也听见了。我下来要救他们。你来！我差你往埃及去。
verses.en: I have indeed seen the oppression of my people in Egypt. I have heard their groaning and have come down to set them free. Now come, I will send you back to Egypt.

verses.zh: 这摩西，就是百姓弃绝说：谁立你作我们的首领和审判官的，神却借那在荆棘中显现之使者的手，差派他作首领作救赎的。
verses.en: This is the same Moses they had rejected with the words, Who made you ruler and judge? He was sent to be their ruler and deliverer by God himself, through the angel who appeared to him in the bush.

verses.zh: 这人领百姓出来，在埃及、在红海、在旷野，四十年间行了奇事神迹。
verses.en: He led them out of Egypt and performed wonders and signs in Egypt, at the Red Sea and for forty years in the wilderness.

verses.zh: 那曾对以色列人说：神要从你们弟兄中间给你们兴起一位先知像我的，就是这位摩西。
verses.en: This is the Moses who told the Israelites, God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your own people.

verses.zh: 这人曾在旷野会中，和西奈山上与那对他说话的天使同在，又与我们的祖宗同在，并且领受活泼的圣言传给我们。
verses.en: He was in the assembly in the wilderness, with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our ancestors; and he received living words to pass on to us.

verses.zh: 我们的祖宗不肯听从，反弃绝他，心里归向埃及，
verses.en: But our ancestors refused to obey him. Instead, they rejected him and in their hearts turned back to Egypt.

verses.zh: 对亚伦说：你且为我们造些神像，在我们前面引路。因为领我们出埃及地的那个摩西，我们不知道他遭了什么事。
verses.en: They told Aaron, Make us gods who will go before us. As for this fellow Moses who led us out of Egypt—we don't know what has happened to him!

verses.zh: 那时，他们造了一个牛犊，又献祭给那像，欢喜自己手中的工作。
verses.en: That was the time they made an idol in the form of a calf. They brought sacrifices to it and reveled in what their own hands had made.

verses.zh: 神就转脸不顾，任凭他们事奉天上的万象，正如先知书上所写的说：以色列家啊，你们四十年间在旷野，岂是将牺牲和祭物献给我吗？
verses.en: But God turned away from them and gave them over to the worship of the sun, moon and stars. This agrees with what is written in the book of the prophets: Did you bring me sacrifices and offerings forty years in the wilderness, people of Israel?

verses.zh: 你们抬着摩洛的帐幕和理番神的星，就是你们所造为要敬拜的像。因此，我要把你们迁徙到巴比伦外去。
verses.en: You have taken up the tabernacle of Molek and the star of your god Rephan, the idols you made to worship. Therefore I will send you into exile beyond Babylon.

verses.zh: 我们的祖宗在旷野有法柜的帐幕，是神吩咐摩西叫他照所看见的样式作的。
verses.en: Our ancestors had the tabernacle of the covenant law with them in the wilderness. It had been made as God directed Moses, according to the pattern he had seen.

verses.zh: 这帐幕，我们的祖宗相继承受，当神在他们面前赶出外邦人去的时候，他们同约书亚把帐幕搬进承受为业的之地，直到大卫的日子。
verses.en: After receiving the tabernacle, our ancestors under Joshua brought it with them when they took the land from the nations God drove out before them. It remained in the land until the time of David,

verses.zh: 大卫在神面前蒙恩，祈求为雅各的神预备居所。
verses.en: who enjoyed God's favor and asked that he might provide a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.

verses.zh: 却是所罗门为神建造殿宇。
verses.en: But it was Solomon who built a house for him.

verses.zh: 其实，至高者并不住人手所造的，就如先知所说：
verses.en: However, the Most High does not live in houses made by human hands. As the prophet says:

verses.zh: 主说：天是我的座位，地是我的脚凳，你们要为我造何等的殿宇？哪里是我安息的地方呢？
verses.en: Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool. What kind of house will you build for me? says the Lord. Or where will my resting place be?

verses.zh: 这一切都是我手所造的吗？
verses.en: Has not my hand made all these things?

verses.zh: 你们这硬着颈项、心与耳未受割礼的人，常时抗拒圣灵。你们的祖宗怎样，你们也怎样。
verses.en: You stiff-necked people! Your hearts and ears are still uncircumcised. You are just like your ancestors: You always resist the Holy Spirit!

verses.zh: 哪一个先知不是你们的祖宗逼迫呢？他们也把预先传说那义者要来的人杀了。如今你们又把那义者卖了，杀了。
verses.en: Was there ever a prophet your ancestors did not persecute? They even killed those who predicted the coming of the Righteous One. And now you have betrayed and murdered him—

verses.zh: 你们受了天使所传的律法，竟不遵守。
verses.en: you who have received the law that was given through angels but have not obeyed it.

verses.zh: 众人听见这话，就极其恼怒，向司提反咬牙切齿。
verses.en: When the members of the Sanhedrin heard this, they were furious and gnashed their teeth at him.

verses.zh: 但司提反被圣灵充满，定睛望天，看见神的荣耀，又看见耶稣站在神的右边。
verses.en: But Stephen, full of the Holy Spirit, looked up to heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.

verses.zh: 就说：我看见天开了，人子站在神的右边。
verses.en: Look, he said, I see heaven open and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.

verses.zh: 众人大声喊叫，捂着耳朵，齐心拥上前去，
verses.en: At this they covered their ears and, yelling at the top of their voices, all rushed at him,

verses.zh: 把他推到城外，用石头打他。作见证的人把衣裳放在一个少年人名叫扫罗的脚前。
verses.en: dragged him out of the city and began to stone him. Meanwhile, the witnesses laid their coats at the feet of a young man named Saul.

verses.zh: 他们正用石头打的时候，司提反呼吁主说：求主耶稣接收我的灵魂。
verses.en: While they were stoning him, Stephen prayed, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.

verses.zh: 又跪下大声喊着说：主啊，不要将这罪归于他们。他们说了这话，就睡了。扫罗也喜悦他被害。
verses.en: Then he fell on his knees and cried out, Lord, do not hold this sin against them. When he had said this, he fell asleep.

verses.zh: 从这日起，耶路撒冷的教会大遭逼迫。除了使徒以外，门徒都分散在犹太和撒马利亚各处。
verses.en: And Saul approved of their killing him. On that day a great persecution broke out against the church in Jerusalem, and all except the apostles were scattered throughout Judea and Samaria.

verses.zh: 有虔诚的人把司提反埋葬了，为他大大地哀哭。
verses.en: Godly men buried Stephen and mourned deeply for him.

verses.zh: 扫罗却残害教会，进各人的家，拉着男女下在监里。
verses.en: But Saul began to destroy the church. Going from house to house, he dragged off both men and women and put them in prison.

verses.zh: 那些分散的人往各处去传道。
verses.en: Those who had been scattered preached the word wherever they went.

verses.zh: 腓利下撒马利亚城去，宣讲基督。
verses.en: Philip went down to a city in Samaria and proclaimed the Messiah there.

verses.zh: 众人听见了，又看见腓利所行的神迹，就同心合意地听从他的话。
verses.en: When the crowds heard Philip and saw the signs he performed, they all paid close attention to what he said.

verses.zh: 因为有许多人被污鬼附着，那些鬼大声呼叫，从他们身上出来。还有许多瘫痪的，瘸腿的，都得了医治。
verses.en: For with shrieks, impure spirits came out of many, and many who were paralyzed or lame were healed.

verses.zh: 在那城里大有欢喜。
verses.en: So there was great joy in that city.

verses.zh: 有一个人名叫西门，向来在那城里行邪术，妄自尊大，使撒马利亚的百姓惊奇。
verses.en: Now for some time a man named Simon had practiced sorcery in the city and amazed all the people of Samaria. He boasted that he was someone great,

verses.zh: 无论大小都听从他，说：这人就是那称为神的大能者。
verses.en: and all the people, both high and low, gave him their attention and exclaimed, This man is rightly called the Great Power of God.

verses.zh: 他们听从他，因为他久用邪术，使他们惊奇。
verses.en: They followed him because he had amazed them for a long time with his sorcery.

verses.zh: 及至他们信了腓利所传神国的福音和耶稣基督的名，连男带女就受了洗。
verses.en: But when they believed Philip as he proclaimed the good news of the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

verses.zh: 西门自己也信了，既受了洗，就常与腓利在一处，见他所行的神迹和大异能，就甚惊奇。
verses.en: Simon himself believed and was baptized. And he followed Philip everywhere, astonished by the great signs and miracles he saw.

verses.zh: 使徒在耶路撒冷听见撒马利亚人领受了神的道，就打发彼得、约翰往他们那里去。
verses.en: When the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had accepted the word of God, they sent Peter and John to Samaria.

verses.zh: 两个人到了，就为他们祷告，要叫他们受圣灵。
verses.en: When they arrived, they prayed for the new believers there that they might receive the Holy Spirit,

verses.zh: 因为圣灵还没有降在他们一个人身上，他们只奉主耶稣的名受了洗。
verses.en: because the Holy Spirit had not yet come on any of them; they had simply been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

verses.zh: 于是使徒按手在他们头上，他们就受了圣灵。
verses.en: Then Peter and John placed their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

verses.zh: 西门看见使徒按手，便有圣灵赐下，就拿钱给使徒，说：
verses.en: When Simon saw that the Spirit was given at the laying on of the apostles' hands, he offered them money

verses.zh: 把这权柄也给我，叫我手按着谁，谁就可以受圣灵。
verses.en: and said, Give me also this ability so that everyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit.

verses.zh: 彼得说：你的银子和你一同灭亡吧！因你想神的恩赐是可以用钱买的。
verses.en: Peter answered: May your money perish with you, because you thought you could buy the gift of God with money!

verses.zh: 你在这道上无分无关，因为在神面前，你的心不正。
verses.en: You have no part or share in this ministry, because your heart is not right before God.

verses.zh: 你当懊悔你这罪恶，祈求主，或者你心里的意念可得赦免。
verses.en: Repent of this wickedness and pray to the Lord in the hope that he may forgive you for having such a thought in your heart.

verses.zh: 我看出你正在苦胆之中，被罪恶捆绑。
verses.en: For I see that you are full of bitterness and captive to sin.

verses.zh: 西门说：愿你们为我求主，叫你们所说的话，没有一样临到我身上。
verses.en: Then Simon answered, Pray to the Lord for me so that nothing you have said may happen to me.

verses.zh: 使徒既证明主道，而且讲论，就回耶路撒冷去，一路在撒马利亚好些村庄传扬福音。
verses.en: After they had further proclaimed the word of the Lord and testified about Jesus, Peter and John returned to Jerusalem, preaching the gospel in many Samaritan villages.

verses.zh: 有主的一个使者对腓利说：起来，向南走，往那从耶路撒冷下迦萨的路上去。那路是旷野。
verses.en: Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip, Go south to the road—the desert road—that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.

verses.zh: 腓利就起身去了。不料，有一个埃提阿伯人，是个有大权的太监，在埃提阿伯女王干大基的手下总管银库，他上耶路撒冷礼拜去。
verses.en: So he started out, and on his way he met an Ethiopian eunuch, an important official in charge of all the treasury of the Kandake (which means queen of the Ethiopians). This man had gone to Jerusalem to worship,

verses.zh: 现在回来，在车上坐着，念先知以赛亚的书。
verses.en: and on his way home was sitting in his chariot reading the Book of Isaiah the prophet.

verses.zh: 圣灵对腓利说：你去贴近那车走。
verses.en: The Spirit told Philip, Go to that chariot and stay near it.

verses.zh: 腓利就跑到太监那里，听见他念先知以赛亚的书，便问他说：你所念的，你明白吗？
verses.en: Then Philip ran up to the chariot and heard the man reading Isaiah the prophet. Do you understand what you are reading? Philip asked.

verses.zh: 他说：没有人指教我，怎能明白呢？于是请腓利上车，与他同坐。
verses.en: How can I, he said, unless someone explains it to me? So he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.

verses.zh: 他所念的那段经，说：他像羊被牵到宰杀之地，又像羊羔在剪毛的人手下无声，他也是这样不开口。
verses.en: This is the passage of Scripture the eunuch was reading: He was led like a sheep to the slaughter, and as a lamb before its shearer is silent, so he did not open his mouth.

verses.zh: 他卑微的时候，人不按公义审判他。（原文作：他的审判被夺去）谁能述说他的世代？因为他的生命从地上夺去。
verses.en: In his humiliation he was deprived of justice. Who can speak of his descendants? For his life was taken from the earth.

verses.zh: 太监对腓利说：请问，先知是指着谁说的？是指着自己呢？是指着别人呢？
verses.en: The eunuch asked Philip, Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?

verses.zh: 腓利就开口从这经上起，对他传讲耶稣。
verses.en: Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.

verses.zh: 二人正往前走，到了有水的地方，太监说：看哪，这里有水，我受洗有什么妨碍呢？（有古卷在此有：腓利说：你若是一心相信，就可以。他回答说：我信耶稣基督是神的儿子。）
verses.en: As they traveled along the road, they came to some water and the eunuch said, Look, here is water. What can stand in the way of my being baptized? (And he gave orders to stop the chariot. Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water and Philip baptized him.)

verses.zh: 腓利说：你若是一心相信，就可以。他回答说：我信耶稣基督是神的儿子。
verses.en: And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.

verses.zh: 于是吩咐车站住，腓利和太监二人同下水里去，腓利就给他施洗。
verses.en: And he commanded the chariot to stand still. And they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.

verses.zh: 从水里上来，主的精神把腓利提了去。太监也不再见他了，就欢欢喜喜地走路。
verses.en: And when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord suddenly took Philip away, and the eunuch did not see him again, but went on his way rejoicing.

verses.zh: 后来有人遇见腓利在亚锁都。他走遍那地方，在各城宣传福音，直到凯撒利亚。
verses.en: Philip, however, appeared at Azotus and traveled about, preaching the gospel in all the towns until he reached Caesarea.

verses.zh: 扫罗仍然向主的门徒口吐威吓凶杀的话，去见大祭司，
verses.en: Meanwhile, Saul was still breathing out murderous threats against the Lord's disciples. He went to the high priest

verses.zh: 求文书给大马士革的各会堂，若是找着信奉这道的人，无论男女，都捆绑带到耶路撒冷。
verses.en: and asked him for letters to the synagogues in Damascus, so that if he found any there who belonged to the Way, whether men or women, he might take them as prisoners to Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 扫罗行路，将到大马士革，忽然从天上发光，四面照着他。
verses.en: As he neared Damascus on his journey, suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him.

verses.zh: 他就仆倒在地，听见有声音对他说：扫罗，扫罗！你为什么逼迫我？
verses.en: He fell to the ground and heard a voice say to him, Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me?

verses.zh: 他说：主啊，你是谁？主说：我就是你所逼迫的耶稣。
verses.en: Who are you, Lord? Saul asked. I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting, he replied.

verses.zh: 起来，进城去，你所当作的事，必有人告诉你。
verses.en: Now get up and go into the city, and you will be told what you must do.

verses.zh: 同行的人站在那里，说不出话来，听见声音，却看不见人。
verses.en: The men traveling with Saul stood there speechless; they heard the sound but did not see anyone.

verses.zh: 扫罗从地上起来，睁开眼睛，竟不能看见什么。有人拉他的手，领他进了大马士革。
verses.en: Saul got up from the ground, but when he opened his eyes he could see nothing. So they led him by the hand into Damascus.

verses.zh: 三日不能看见，也不吃，也不喝。
verses.en: For three days he was blind, and did not eat or drink anything.

verses.zh: 当下，在大马士革有一个门徒，名叫亚拿尼亚。主在异象中对他说：亚拿尼亚。
verses.en: In Damascus there was a disciple named Ananias. The Lord called to him in a vision, Ananias! Yes, Lord, he answered.

verses.zh: 主对他说：起来，往直街去，在犹大的家里，访问一个大数人名叫扫罗。他正祷告，
verses.en: The Lord told him, Go to the house of Judas on Straight Street and ask for a man from Tarsus named Saul, for he is praying.

verses.zh: 又看见了一个人，名叫亚拿尼亚，进来按手在他身上，叫他能看见。
verses.en: In a vision he has seen a man named Ananias come and place his hands on him to restore his sight.

verses.zh: 亚拿尼亚回答说：主啊，我听见许多人说，这人怎样在耶路撒冷多多苦害你的圣徒，
verses.en: Lord, Ananias answered, I have heard many reports about this man and all the harm he has done to your holy people in Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 并且他在这里有从祭司长得来的权柄，捆绑一切求告你名的人。
verses.en: And he has come here with authority from the chief priests to arrest all who call on your name.

verses.zh: 主对亚拿尼亚说：你只管去！他是我所拣选的器皿，要在外邦人和君王并以色列人面前宣扬我的名。
verses.en: But the Lord said to Ananias, Go! This man is my chosen instrument to proclaim my name to the Gentiles and their kings and to the people of Israel.

verses.zh: 我也要指示他，为我的名必须受许多的苦难。
verses.en: I will show him how much he must suffer for my name.

verses.zh: 亚拿尼亚就去了，进入那家，把手按在扫罗身上，说：兄弟扫罗，在你来的路上，向你显现的主，就是耶稣，打发我来，叫你能看见，又被圣灵充满。
verses.en: Then Ananias went to the house and entered it. Placing his hands on Saul, he said, Brother Saul, the Lord—Jesus, who appeared to you on the road as you were coming here—has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.

verses.zh: 扫罗的眼睛上，好像有鳞立刻掉下来，他就能看见。于是起来，受了洗。
verses.en: Immediately, something like scales fell from Saul's eyes, and he could see again. He got up and was baptized,

verses.zh: 吃过饭就健壮了。扫罗和大马士革的门徒同住了些日子，
verses.en: and after taking some food, he regained his strength. Saul spent several days with the disciples in Damascus.

verses.zh: 立刻在各会堂里宣传耶稣，说他是神的儿子。
verses.en: At once he began to preach in the synagogues that Jesus is the Son of God.

verses.zh: 凡听见的人都惊奇，说：在耶路撒冷残害求告这名的人，不是这人吗？并且他到这里来，特要捆绑他们，带到祭司长那里。
verses.en: All those who heard him were astonished and asked, Isn't he the man who raised havoc in Jerusalem among those who call on this name? And hasn't he come here to take them as prisoners to the chief priests?

verses.zh: 但扫罗越发有能力，驳倒外邦人，证明耶稣是基督。
verses.en: Yet Saul grew more and more powerful and baffled the Jews living in Damascus by proving that Jesus is the Messiah.

verses.zh: 过了好些日子，犹太人商议要杀扫罗。
verses.en: After many days had gone by, there was a conspiracy among the Jews to kill him,

verses.zh: 但他们的计谋被扫罗知道了。他们又昼夜在城门守候，要杀他。
verses.en: but Saul learned of their plan. Day and night they kept close watch on the city gates in order to kill him.

verses.zh: 他的门徒就在夜间用筐子把他从城墙上缒下去。
verses.en: But his followers took him by night and lowered him in a basket through an opening in the wall.

verses.zh: 扫罗到了耶路撒冷，想与门徒结交。他们却都怕他，不信他是门徒。
verses.en: When he came to Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples, but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he really was a disciple.

verses.zh: 惟有巴拿巴接待他，领去见使徒，把他在路上怎样看见主，主怎样对他说话，他在大马士革怎样奉耶稣的名放胆传道，都述说出来。
verses.en: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles. He told them how Saul on his journey had seen the Lord and that the Lord had spoken to him, and how in Damascus he had preached fearlessly in the name of Jesus.

verses.zh: 于是扫罗在耶路撒冷和他们同住，奉主的名放胆传道。
verses.en: So Saul stayed with them and moved about freely in Jerusalem, speaking boldly in the name of the Lord.

verses.zh: 又与说希腊话的犹太人讲论辩驳，他们却想法子要杀他。
verses.en: He talked and debated with the Hellenistic Jews, but they tried to kill him.

verses.zh: 弟兄们知道了，就送他下凯撒利亚，打发他往大数去。
verses.en: When the believers learned of this, they took him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.

verses.zh: 那时，犹太、加利利、撒马利亚各处的教会都得平安，被建立。凡事敬畏主，蒙圣灵的安慰，人数就增多了。
verses.en: Then the church throughout Judea, Galilee and Samaria enjoyed a time of peace and was strengthened. Living in the fear of the Lord and encouraged by the Holy Spirit, it increased in numbers.

verses.zh: 彼得周游四方的时候，也到了居住吕大的圣徒那里。
verses.en: As Peter traveled about the country, he went to visit the Lord's people who lived in Lydda.

verses.zh: 遇见一个人，名叫以尼雅，得了瘫痪，在褥子上躺卧八年。
verses.en: There he found a man named Aeneas, who was paralyzed and had been bedridden for eight years.

verses.zh: 彼得对他说：以尼雅，耶稣基督医好你了。起来，收拾你的褥子。他就立刻起来了。
verses.en: Aeneas, Peter said to him, Jesus Christ heals you. Get up and roll up your mat. Immediately Aeneas got up.

verses.zh: 凡住吕大和沙仑的人都看见了他，就归服主。
verses.en: All those who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.

verses.zh: 在约帕有一个女徒，名叫大比大，翻希腊话就是多加（就是羚羊的意思）。她广行善事，多施赒济。
verses.en: In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha (in Greek her name is Dorcas); she was always doing good and helping the poor.

verses.zh: 当时，她病了，死了。人给她洗澡以后，停在楼上。
verses.en: About that time she became sick and died, and her body was washed and placed in an upstairs room.

verses.zh: 吕大原离约帕不远，门徒听见彼得在那里，就打发两个人去见他，央求他说：快到我们那里去，不要耽延。
verses.en: Lydda was near Joppa; so when the disciples heard that Peter was in Lydda, they sent two men to him and urged him, Please come at once!

verses.zh: 彼得就起身和他们同去。到了，就有人领他上楼。众寡妇都站在旁边哭，拿多加与他们同在时所做的里衣外衣给他看。
verses.en: Peter went with them, and when he arrived he was taken upstairs to the room. All the widows stood around him, crying and showing him the robes and other clothing that Dorcas had made while she was still with them.

verses.zh: 彼得叫他们都出去，就跪下祷告，转身对死人说：大比大，起来！她就睁开眼睛，见了彼得，便坐起来。
verses.en: Peter sent them all out of the room; then he got down on his knees and prayed. Turning toward the dead woman, he said, Tabitha, get up. She opened her eyes, and seeing Peter she sat up.

verses.zh: 彼得伸手扶她起来，叫众圣徒和寡妇进去，把多加活活地交给他们。
verses.en: He took her by the hand and helped her to her feet. Then he called for the believers, especially the widows, and presented her to them alive.

verses.zh: 这事传遍了约帕，就有许多人信了主。
verses.en: This became known all over Joppa, and many people believed in the Lord.

verses.zh: 彼得在约帕一个硝皮匠西门的家里住了多日。
verses.en: Peter stayed in Joppa for some time with a tanner named Simon.

verses.zh: 在凯撒利亚有一个人，名叫哥尼流，是意大利营的百夫长。
verses.en: At Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion in what was known as the Italian Regiment.

verses.zh: 他是个虔诚人，他和全家都敬畏神，多多赒济百姓，常常祷告神。
verses.en: He and all his family were devout and God-fearing; he gave generously to those in need and prayed to God regularly.

verses.zh: 有一天，约在申初，他在异象中明明看见神的一个使者进去，到他那里，说：哥尼流。
verses.en: One day at about three in the afternoon he had a vision. He distinctly saw an angel of God, who came to him and said, Cornelius!

verses.zh: 哥尼流定睛看他，惊怕说：主啊，什么事呢？天使说：你的祷告和你的赒济达到神面前，已蒙记念了。
verses.en: Cornelius stared at him in fear. What is it, Lord? he asked. The angel answered, Your prayers and gifts to the poor have come up as a memorial offering before God.

verses.zh: 现在你当打发人往约帕去，请那称呼彼得的西门来。
verses.en: Now send men to Joppa to bring back a man named Simon who is called Peter.

verses.zh: 他住在海边一个硝皮匠西门的家里，房子在海边上。
verses.en: He is staying with Simon the tanner, whose house is by the sea.

verses.zh: 向他说话的天使去后，哥尼流叫了两个家人和常伺候他的一个虔诚兵来。
verses.en: When the angel who spoke to him had gone, Cornelius called two of his servants and a devout soldier who was one of his attendants.

verses.zh: 把这事都述说给他们听，就打发他们往约帕去。
verses.en: He told them everything that had happened and sent them to Joppa.

verses.zh: 第二天，他们行路将近那城的时候，彼得约在午正，上房顶去祷告。
verses.en: The next day, as they were on their journey and approaching the city, Peter went up on the roof to pray. It was about noon,

verses.zh: 觉得饿了，想要吃。那家的人正预备饭的时候，彼得魂游象外，
verses.en: and he became hungry and wanted something to eat. While the meal was being prepared, he fell into a trance.

verses.zh: 看见天开了，有一物降下，好像一块大布，系着四角，缒在地上。
verses.en: He saw heaven opened and something like a large sheet being let down to earth by its four corners.

verses.zh: 里面有地上各样四足的走兽和昆虫，并天上的飞鸟。
verses.en: It contained all kinds of four-footed animals, as well as reptiles and birds.

verses.zh: 又有声音向他说：彼得，起来，宰了吃。
verses.en: Then a voice told him, Get up, Peter. Kill and eat.

verses.zh: 彼得却说：主啊，这是不可的！凡俗物和不洁净的物，我从来没有吃过。
verses.en: Surely not, Lord! Peter replied. I have never eaten anything impure or unclean.

verses.zh: 第二次有声音向他说：神所洁净的，你不可当作俗物。
verses.en: The voice spoke to him a second time, Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.

verses.zh: 这样一连三次，那物随即收回天上去了。
verses.en: This happened three times, and immediately the sheet was taken back to heaven.

verses.zh: 彼得心里正在猜疑之间，不知这异象是什么意思。哥尼流所差来的人已经访问到西门的家，站在门外，
verses.en: While Peter was wondering about the meaning of the vision, the men sent by Cornelius found out where Simon's house was and stopped at the gate.

verses.zh: 喊着问：有称呼彼得的西门住在这里没有？
verses.en: They called out, asking if Simon who was known as Peter was staying there.

verses.zh: 彼得还思想那异象的时候，圣灵向他说：有三个人来找你。
verses.en: While Peter was still thinking about the vision, the Spirit said to him, Simon, three men are looking for you.

verses.zh: 起来，下去，和他们同往，不要疑惑，因为是我差他们来的。
verses.en: So go downstairs and accompany them. Don't hesitate to go with them, for I have sent them.

verses.zh: 于是彼得下去见那些人，说：我就是你们所找的人。你们来是为什么缘故？
verses.en: Peter went down and said to the men, I'm the one you're looking for. Why have you come?

verses.zh: 他们说：百夫长哥尼流是个义人，敬畏神，为犹太通国所称赞。他蒙一位圣天使指示，叫他请你到他家里去，听你的话。
verses.en: The men replied, We have come from Cornelius the centurion. He is a righteous and God-fearing man, who is respected by all the Jewish people. A holy angel told him to ask you to come to his house so that he could hear what you have to say.

verses.zh: 彼得就请他们进去，住了一宿。次日，起身和他们同去，还有约帕的几个弟兄同着他去。
verses.en: Then Peter invited the men into the house to be his guests. The next day Peter started out with them, and some of the believers from Joppa went along.

verses.zh: 又次日，他们进入凯撒利亚，哥尼流已经请了他的亲属密友等候他们。
verses.en: The following day he arrived in Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.

verses.zh: 彼得一进去，哥尼流就迎接他，俯伏在他脚前拜他。
verses.en: As Peter entered the house, Cornelius met him and fell at his feet in reverence.

verses.zh: 彼得却拉他，说：起来，我也是人。
verses.en: But Peter made him get up. Stand up, he said, I am only a man myself.

verses.zh: 彼得和他说话，进去见有许多人在那里聚集，
verses.en: While talking with him, Peter went inside and found a large gathering of people.

verses.zh: 就对他们说：你们知道，犹太人和别国的人亲近来往本是不合例的，但神已经指示我，无论什么人都不可看作俗而不洁净的。
verses.en: He said to them: You are well aware that it is against our law for a Jew to associate with or visit a Gentile. But God has shown me that I should not call anyone impure or unclean.

verses.zh: 所以我被请的时候，就不推辞而来。现在请问：你们叫我来有什么意思呢？
verses.en: So when I was sent for, I came without raising any objection. May I ask why you sent for me?

verses.zh: 哥尼流说：前四天，这个时候，我在家中守着申初的祷告，忽然有一个人穿着光明的衣裳，站在我面前，
verses.en: Cornelius answered: Three days ago I was in my house praying at this hour, at three in the afternoon. Suddenly a man in shining clothes stood before me

verses.zh: 说：哥尼流，你的祷告已蒙垂听，你的赒济达到神面前已蒙记念了。
verses.en: and said, Cornelius, God has heard your prayer and remembered your gifts to the poor.

verses.zh: 你当打发人往约帕去，请那称呼彼得的西门来，他住在海边一个硝皮匠西门的家里。
verses.en: Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter. He is a guest in the home of Simon the tanner, who lives by the sea.

verses.zh: 所以我立刻打发人去请你。你来了很好。现今我们都在神面前，要听主所吩咐你的一切话。
verses.en: So I sent for you immediately, and it was good of you to come. Now we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has commanded you to tell us.

verses.zh: 彼得就开口说：我真看出神是不偏待人。
verses.en: Then Peter began to speak: I now realize how true it is that God does not show favoritism

verses.zh: 原来，各国中那敬畏主、行义的人都为主所悦纳。
verses.en: but accepts from every nation the one who fears him and does what is right.

verses.zh: 神借着耶稣基督（他是万有的主）传和平的福音，将这道赐给以色列人。
verses.en: You know the message God sent to the people of Israel, announcing the good news of peace through Jesus Christ, who is Lord of all.

verses.zh: 这话在约翰施洗以后，从加利利起，传遍了犹太。
verses.en: You know what has happened throughout the province of Judea, beginning in Galilee after the baptism that John preached—

verses.zh: 神怎样以圣灵和能力膏拿撒勒人耶稣，这都是你们知道的。他周游四方，行善事，医好凡被魔鬼压制的人，因为神与他同在。
verses.en: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and power, and how he went around doing good and healing all who were under the power of the devil, because God was with him.

verses.zh: 他在犹太人之地，并耶路撒冷所行的一切事，有我们作见证。他们竟把他挂在木头上杀了。
verses.en: We are witnesses of everything he did in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem. They killed him by hanging him on a cross,

verses.zh: 第三日，神叫他复活，显现出来，
verses.en: but God raised him from the dead on the third day and caused him to be seen.

verses.zh: 不是显现给众人看，乃是显现给神预先所拣选为他作见证的人看，就是我们这些在他从死里复活以后和他同吃同喝的人。
verses.en: He was not seen by all the people, but by witnesses whom God had already chosen—by us who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.

verses.zh: 他吩咐我们传道给众人，证明他是神所立定的，要作审判活人死人的主。
verses.en: He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that he is the one whom God appointed as judge of the living and the dead.

verses.zh: 众先知也为他作见证说：凡信他的人，必因他的名得蒙赦罪。
verses.en: All the prophets testify about him that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name.

verses.zh: 使徒和在犹太的众弟兄听说外邦人也领受了神的道。
verses.en: The apostles and the believers throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.

verses.zh: 及至彼得上了耶路撒冷，那些受割礼的门徒和他争辩说：
verses.en: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, the circumcised believers criticized him

verses.zh: 你进入未受割礼之人的家，和他们一同吃饭了。
verses.en: and said, You went into the house of uncircumcised men and ate with them.

verses.zh: 彼得就开口，把这事挨次给他们讲解说：
verses.en: Starting from the beginning, Peter told them the whole story:

verses.zh: 我在约帕城里祷告的时候，魂游象外，看见异象，有一物降下，好像一块大布，系着四角，从天缒下，直来到我跟前。
verses.en: I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision. I saw something like a large sheet being let down from heaven by its four corners, and it came down to where I was.

verses.zh: 我定睛观看，见内中有地上四足的牲畜和野兽、昆虫，并天上的飞鸟。
verses.en: I looked into it and saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, reptiles and birds.

verses.zh: 我且听见有声音向我说：彼得，起来，宰了吃。
verses.en: Then I heard a voice telling me, Get up, Peter. Kill and eat.

verses.zh: 我说：主啊，这是不可的！凡俗物和不洁净的物从来没有入过我的口。
verses.en: I replied, Surely not, Lord! Nothing impure or unclean has ever entered my mouth.

verses.zh: 第二次，有声音从天上说：神所洁净的，你不可当作俗物。
verses.en: The voice spoke from heaven a second time, Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.

verses.zh: 这样一连三次，就都收回天上去了。
verses.en: This happened three times, and then it was all pulled up to heaven again.

verses.zh: 正当那时，有三个人站在我们所住的房门前，是从凯撒利亚差来见我的。
verses.en: Right then three men who had been sent to me from Caesarea stopped at the house where I was staying.

verses.zh: 圣灵吩咐我和他们同去，不要疑惑。同着我去的，还有这六位弟兄，我们都进了那人的家。
verses.en: The Spirit told me to have no hesitation about going with them. These six brothers also went with me, and we entered the man's house.

verses.zh: 他就告诉我们，他如何看见一位天使站在他屋里，说：你打发人往约帕去，请那称呼彼得的西门来。
verses.en: He told us how he had seen an angel appear in his house and say, Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter.

verses.zh: 他要传话给你，可以叫你和你的全家得救。
verses.en: He will bring you a message through which you and all your household will be saved.

verses.zh: 我一开讲，圣灵便降在他们身上，正像当初降在我们身上一样。
verses.en: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit came on them as he had come on us at the beginning.

verses.zh: 我就想起主的话说：约翰是用水施洗，但你们要受圣灵的洗。
verses.en: Then I remembered what the Lord had said: John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.

verses.zh: 神既然给他们恩赐，像在我们信主耶稣基督的时候给我们一样，我是谁，能拦阻神呢？
verses.en: So if God gave them the same gift he gave us who believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to think that I could stand in God's way?

verses.zh: 众人听见这话，就不言语了，只归荣耀与神，说：这样看来，神也赐恩给外邦人，叫他们悔改得生命了。
verses.en: When they heard this, they had no further objections and praised God, saying, So then, even to Gentiles God has granted repentance that leads to life.

verses.zh: 那些因司提反的事遭患难四散的门徒，直传到腓尼基和居比路，并安提阿。他们不向别人讲道，只向犹太人讲道。
verses.en: Now those who had been scattered by the persecution that broke out when Stephen was killed traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus and Antioch, spreading the word only among Jews.

verses.zh: 但其中有居比路和古利奈人，他们到了安提阿，也向希腊人传讲主耶稣。
verses.en: Some of them, however, men from Cyprus and Cyrene, went to Antioch and began to speak to Greeks also, telling them the good news about the Lord Jesus.

verses.zh: 主的手与他们同在，信而归主的人数就很多。
verses.en: The Lord's hand was with them, and a great number of people believed and turned to the Lord.

verses.zh: 这风声传到耶路撒冷教会人的耳中，他们就打发巴拿巴出去，走到安提阿为止。
verses.en: News of this reached the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch.

verses.zh: 他到了那里，看见神所赐的恩，就欢喜，劝勉众人，立定心志，恒久靠主。
verses.en: When he arrived and saw what the grace of God had done, he was glad and encouraged them all to remain true to the Lord with all their hearts.

verses.zh: 这巴拿巴原是个好人，被圣灵充满，大有信心。于是有许多人归服了主。
verses.en: He was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and faith, and a great number of people were brought to the Lord.

verses.zh: 他又往大数去找扫罗，找着了，就带他到安提阿去。
verses.en: Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul,

verses.zh: 他们足有一年的工夫，和教会一同聚集，教训了许多人。门徒称为基督徒，是从安提阿起首。
verses.en: and when he found him, he brought him to Antioch. So for a whole year Barnabas and Saul met with the church and taught great numbers of people. The disciples were called Christians first at Antioch.

verses.zh: 当那些日子，有几位先知从耶路撒冷下到安提阿。
verses.en: During this time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

verses.zh: 内中有一位，名叫亚迦布，站起来，借着圣灵指明天下将有大饥荒。这事到革老丢年间果然有了。
verses.en: One of them, named Agabus, stood up and through the Spirit predicted that a severe famine would spread over the entire Roman world. (This happened during the reign of Claudius.)

verses.zh: 于是门徒定意，照各人的力量捐钱，送去供给住在犹太的弟兄。
verses.en: The disciples, as each one was able, decided to provide help for the brothers and sisters living in Judea.

verses.zh: 他们就这样行，把捐项托巴拿巴和扫罗送到众长老那里。
verses.en: This they did, sending their gift to the elders by Barnabas and Saul.

verses.zh: 那时，希律王下手苦害教会中几个人。
verses.en: It was about this time that King Herod arrested some who belonged to the church, intending to persecute them.

verses.zh: 用刀杀了约翰的哥哥雅各。
verses.en: He had James, the brother of John, put to death with the sword.

verses.zh: 他见犹太人喜欢这事，又去捉拿彼得。那时正是除酵节的日子。
verses.en: When he saw that this met with approval among the Jews, he proceeded to seize Peter also. This happened during the Festival of Unleavened Bread.

verses.zh: 希律拿了彼得，收在监里，交付四班兵丁看守，每班四个人，意思要在逾越节后把他提出来，当着百姓办他。
verses.en: After arresting him, he put him in prison, handing him over to be guarded by four squads of four soldiers each. Herod intended to bring him out for public trial after the Passover.

verses.zh: 于是彼得被囚在监里；教会却为他切切地祷告神。
verses.en: So Peter was kept in prison, but the church was earnestly praying to God for him.

verses.zh: 希律将要提他出来的前一夜，彼得被两条铁链锁着，睡在两个兵丁当中；看守的人也在门外看守。
verses.en: The night before Herod was to bring him to trial, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and sentries stood guard at the entrance.

verses.zh: 忽然，有主的一个使者站在旁边，屋里有光照耀，天使拍彼得的肋旁，拍醒了他，说：快快起来！那铁链就从他手上脱落下来。
verses.en: Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared and a light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side and woke him up. Quick, get up! he said, and the chains fell off Peter's wrists.

verses.zh: 天使对他说：束上带子，穿上鞋。他就那样做。天使又说：披上外衣，跟我来。
verses.en: Then the angel said to him, Put on your clothes and sandals. And Peter did so. Wrap your cloak around you and follow me, the angel told him.

verses.zh: 彼得就出来跟着他，不知道天使所做是真的，只当见了异象。
verses.en: Peter followed him out of the prison, but he had no idea that what the angel was doing was really happening; he thought he was seeing a vision.

verses.zh: 过了第一层第二层监牢，来到临街的铁门，那门自己开了。他们出来，走过一条街，天使便离开他去了。
verses.en: They passed the first and second guards and came to the iron gate leading to the city. It opened for them by itself, and they went through it. When they had walked the length of one street, suddenly the angel left him.

verses.zh: 彼得醒悟过来，说：现在我知道主实在差遣他的使者，救我脱离希律的手和犹太百姓一切所盼望的。
verses.en: Then Peter came to himself and said, Now I know without a doubt that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from Herod's clutches and from everything the Jewish people were hoping would happen.

verses.zh: 想了一想，就往那称呼马可的约翰他母亲马利亚家去，在那里有许多人聚集祷告。
verses.en: When this had dawned on him, he went to the house of Mary the mother of John, also called Mark, where many people had gathered and were praying.

verses.zh: 彼得敲外门，有一个使女名叫罗大出来探听。
verses.en: Peter knocked at the outer entrance, and a servant named Rhoda came to answer the door.

verses.zh: 她认得彼得的声音，就欢喜得顾不得开门，跑进去告诉众人说：彼得站在门外。
verses.en: When she recognized Peter's voice, she was so overjoyed she ran back without opening it and exclaimed, Peter is at the door!

verses.zh: 他们说：你是疯了。她再三地说：真是他。他们说：必是他的天使。
verses.en: You're out of your mind, they told her. When she kept insisting that it was so, they said, It must be his angel.

verses.zh: 彼得不住地敲门。他们开了门，看见他，就甚惊奇。
verses.en: But Peter kept on knocking, and when they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.

verses.zh: 彼得摆手，叫他们安静，听他说：主怎样领我出监，我都告诉你们。也嘱咐他们说：把这些事告诉雅各和众弟兄。于是出去往别处去了。
verses.en: Peter motioned with his hand for them to be quiet and described how the Lord had brought him out of prison. Tell James and the other brothers and sisters about this, he said, and then he left for another place.

verses.zh: 到了天亮，兵丁扰乱得很，不知道彼得往哪里去了。
verses.en: In the morning, there was no small commotion among the soldiers as to what had become of Peter.

verses.zh: 希律找他，找不着，就审问看守的人，吩咐把他们拉去杀了。后来希律离开犹太，下凯撒利亚去，住在那里。
verses.en: After Herod had a thorough search made for him and did not find him, he cross-examined the guards and ordered that they be executed. Then Herod went from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there.

verses.zh: 希律恼怒推罗、西顿的人。他们那一带地方是从王的地土得粮，因此就托了王的内侍臣伯拉斯都的一句话，求和。
verses.en: He had been quarreling with the people of Tyre and Sidon; they now joined together and sought an audience with him. After securing the support of Blastus, a trusted personal servant of the king, they asked for peace,

verses.zh: 希律在所定的日子，穿上朝服，坐在位上，对他们讲论一番。
verses.en: because they depended on the king's country for their food supply. On the appointed day Herod, wearing his royal robes, sat on his throne and delivered a public address to the people.

verses.zh: 百姓喊着说：这是神的声音，不是人的声音。
verses.en: They shouted, This is the voice of a god, not of a man.

verses.zh: 希律不归荣耀给神，所以主的使者立刻罚他，他被虫所咬，气就绝了。
verses.en: Immediately, because Herod did not give praise to God, an angel of the Lord struck him down, and he was eaten by worms and died.

verses.zh: 神的道日见兴旺，越发广传。
verses.en: But the word of God continued to spread and flourish.

verses.zh: 巴拿巴和扫罗办完了他们供给的事，就从耶路撒冷回去，带着约翰，又称马可的同去。
verses.en: When Barnabas and Saul had finished their mission, they returned from Jerusalem, taking with them John, also called Mark.

verses.zh: 在安提阿的教会中，有几位先知和教师，就是巴拿巴和称呼尼结的西面、古利奈人路求，与分封之王希律同养的马念，并扫罗。
verses.en: Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen (who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch) and Saul.

verses.zh: 他们事奉主、禁食的时候，圣灵说：要为我分派巴拿巴和扫罗，去做我召他们所做的工。
verses.en: While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.

verses.zh: 于是禁食祷告，按手在他们头上，就打发他们去了。
verses.en: So after they had fasted and prayed, they placed their hands on them and sent them off.

verses.zh: 他们既被圣灵差遣，就下到西流基，从那里坐船往居比路去。
verses.en: The two of them, sent on their way by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia and sailed from there to Cyprus.

verses.zh: 到了撒拉米，就在犹太人各会堂里传讲神的道，也有约翰作他们的帮手。
verses.en: When they arrived at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. John was with them as their helper.

verses.zh: 经过全岛，直到帕弗，在那里遇见一个有法术的假先知，是个犹太人，名叫巴耶稣。
verses.en: They traveled through the whole island until they came to Paphos. There they met a Jewish sorcerer and false prophet named Bar-Jesus,

verses.zh: 这人常和方伯士求保罗同在。士求保罗是个通达人，他请了巴拿巴和扫罗来，要听神的道。
verses.en: who was an attendant of the proconsul, Sergius Paulus. The proconsul, an intelligent man, sent for Barnabas and Saul because he wanted to hear the word of God.

verses.zh: 只是那行法术的以吕马（这名翻出来就是行法术的意思）敌挡他们，要叫方伯不信真道。
verses.en: But Elymas the sorcerer (for that is what his name means) opposed them and tried to turn the proconsul from the faith.

verses.zh: 扫罗又名保罗，被圣灵充满，定睛看他，说：
verses.en: Then Saul, who was also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked straight at Elymas and said,

verses.zh: 你这充满各样诡诈奸恶的魔鬼的儿子，众善的仇敌，你混乱主的正道还不止住吗？
verses.en: You are a child of the devil and an enemy of everything that is right! You are full of all kinds of deceit and trickery. Will you never stop perverting the right ways of the Lord?

verses.zh: 现在主的手加在你身上，你要瞎眼，暂且不见日光。他的眼睛立刻昏蒙黑暗，四下里求人拉着手领他。
verses.en: Now the hand of the Lord is against you. You are going to be blind for a time, not even able to see the light of the sun. Immediately mist and darkness came over him, and he groped about, seeking someone to lead him by the hand.

verses.zh: 方伯看见这事，就信了，因主的工作而希奇。
verses.en: When the proconsul saw what had happened, he believed, for he was amazed at the teaching about the Lord.

verses.zh: 保罗和他的同人从帕弗开船，来到旁非利亚的别加。约翰就离开他们，回耶路撒冷去。
verses.en: From Paphos, Paul and his companions sailed to Perga in Pamphylia, where John left them to return to Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 他们离了别加往前行，来到彼西底的安提阿，在安息日进会堂坐下。
verses.en: But they continued on from Perga to Antioch in Pisidia, and on the Sabbath they entered the synagogue and sat down.

verses.zh: 读完了律法书和先知书，管会堂的叫人过去，对他们说：二位兄台，若有劝勉众人的话，请说。
verses.en: After the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the leaders of the synagogue sent word to them, saying, Brothers, if you have a word of exhortation for the people, please speak.

verses.zh: 保罗就站起来，举手说：以色列人和一切敬畏神的人，请听。
verses.en: Standing up, Paul motioned with his hand and said: Fellow Israelites and you Gentiles who worship God, listen to me!

verses.zh: 这以色列民的神拣选了我们的祖宗，当以色列民在埃及地作客旅的时候，抬举他们，用大能的手领他们出来。
verses.en: The God of the people of Israel chose our fathers; he made the people prosper during their stay in Egypt; with mighty power he led them out of that country;

verses.zh: 又在旷野容忍他们约有四十年。
verses.en: for about forty years he endured their conduct in the wilderness;

verses.zh: 既灭了迦南地七族的人，就把那地分给他们为业。
verses.en: and he overthrew seven nations in Canaan, giving their land to his people as their inheritance.

verses.zh: 此后，给他们设立士师，约有四百五十年，直到先知撒母耳的时候。
verses.en: All this took about 450 years. After this, God gave them judges until the time of Samuel the prophet.

verses.zh: 后来他们求一个王，神就将便雅悯支派中，基士的儿子扫罗，给他们作王四十年。
verses.en: Then the people asked for a king, and he gave them Saul son of Kish, of the tribe of Benjamin, who ruled forty years.

verses.zh: 既废了扫罗，就选立大卫作他们的王，又为他作见证说：我寻得耶西的儿子大卫，他是合我心意的人，凡事要遵行我的旨意。
verses.en: After removing Saul, he made David their king. God testified concerning him: 'I have found David son of Jesse, a man after my own heart; he will do everything I want him to do.'

verses.zh: 从这人的后裔中，神已经照着所应许的，为以色列人立了一位救主，就是耶稣。
